item.title: We're not ready for the impact of generative AI on elections
item.description: ZDNET's resident presidential scholar takes a deep dive into political campaign deepfakes in the time of generative AI. This affects much more than the national contests. AI will transform local politics, too.

item.title: YouTube adding longer ad breaks for TV viewers, removing some creator ad control
item.description: If you watch YouTube on your television or you're a YouTube content creator, you'll notice some changes soon.

item.title: Google wants to remind you that the Pixel 8 exists ahead of next week's iPhone 15 event
item.description: A number of 'leaks' over the past week has led to an official preview of the upcoming Google Pixel phones and smartwatch.

item.title: The best blood pressure watches of 2023
item.description: ZDNET examined research from Harvard Medical School and considered FDA clearance to find the best blood pressure watches available now.

item.title: Google Chrome is getting a fresh look for its 15th birthday
item.description: The Material You redesign is finally coming to the desktop version of Chrome.

item.title: The Apple products you shouldn't buy this month: September 2023 edition
item.description: Don't waste your money. Check this list before you shop.

item.title: The best robot vacuum mops of 2023: Expert tested and reviewed
item.description: We went hands-on with the best robot vacuum and mop combos from iRobot, Roborock, and more, to see which ones clean the best (and are worth your money).

item.title: The best streaming services for NFL of 2023
item.description: Football season is officially here. Stream NFL games at home with the top streaming services for the NFL, including YouTube TV, Amazon Prime, ESPN+, and Fubo.

item.title: Apple updates iPhone, Apple Watch, and Mac with rare last-minute bug fixes
item.description: The latest updates should be the last ones before Apple releases new OS versions later this month.

item.title: Google to require political ads to reveal if they're AI-generated
item.description: Starting this fall, AI-generated political ads that appear on a Google platform must disclose to users if they contain 'synthetic' content.

item.title: The best phones for kids in 2023: Expert tested and reviewed
item.description: Want to give your child some freedom but still remain connected? The best kids' phones have strong performance, location-tracking technology, and fantastic battery life.

item.title: TikTok quietly added a fast-forward option, and it's a game-changer
item.description: Tired of sitting through lengthy intros or long TikToks? Now you won't have to.

item.title: The best fitness rings of 2023: Oura, Evie, and more
item.description: These top fitness rings are subtler and lighter than your average smartwatch.

item.title: Apple is reportedly throwing millions of dollars a day into AI development
item.description: The tech giant appears to have a multi-pronged approach to catch up with the generative AI boom.

item.title: AI is great at coding, but there are some massive caveats
item.description: GitLab survey reveals technologists' anxiety about AI's intellectual property and security implications.

item.title: Anthropic unveils Claude Pro, a paid subscription plan for its ChatGPT rival
item.description: Here's what a Claude Pro subscription plan costs, what it gets you, and how to sign up.

item.title: Learn Windows PowerShell for just $20
item.description: Prepare for a career as a Windows system administrator by learning PowerShell and scripting with this six-course bundle.

item.title: Android's September security update fixes actively exploited zero-day and more
item.description: A high-severity vulnerability is being patched in the soon-to-be-released September Android security update, along with critical vulnerabilities. Here's what you need to know.

item.title: Learn how to turn your computer into a music studio with Ableton Live training
item.description: For $60, get a lifetime subscription to the Noiselab Music Production Hub to learn essential Ableton Live skills and tools and connect with a community of professionals.

item.title: Microsoft to reveal AI plans for OneDrive in October event
item.description: Mark your calendar if you want a "sneak peek" at how AI will fuel new search, sharing, and queries for your OneDrive files.
